intro: Gaertnera fractiflexa, commonly known as the flexed stem plant, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species. The plant is characterized by its slender, flexible stems that often arch downward, giving it a unique appearance. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its small, white flowers bloom in clusters. Gaertnera fractiflexa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
